name: Solo Sokos Hotel Torni

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Had everything to make our stay in beautiful Helsinki a comfortable one. Location: Check. Centrally located in City Centre and within walking distance to most attractions including the ferry terminal (15 minute walk). Rooms: Check. Spacious rooms with high ceilings and plenty of natural light. Not a big fan of open showers (drain on floor) in the bathroom but that seems the norm in Europe. Service: Check. Very helpful at the front desk with any questions or requests we had. Had to catch a taxi at 4am and they had extra sandwiches waiting for us for our trip. Breakfast: Check. Quite impressed with the breakfast bar with cold and hot options. Ate big breakfasts everything morning to save on going out to lunch.
reviews.title: Excellant Stay

reviews.text: Be sure to check out Ateljee Bar on the roof of the hotel. Excellant place to wind down the evening and watch a spectacular sunset.
reviews.title: Beautiful view over the City of Helsinki

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Try to get a room with a scenary view over Helsinki or at least visit the Ateljee Bar to see the beautiful Helsinki on top of the roofs.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel, all you want and more

reviews.text: Quite superb hotel. We stayed four nights then one night on our return to Helsinki, so we got to stay in Jugendstil and Art Deco rooms. Jugendstil was more spacious, both styles are beautifully carried off. Excellent bathrooms, great breakfast (one of the best hotel buffets I've had), free wifi, really helpful staff. And not expensive - less than £80 a night. No doubt in my mind where I'd stay if I returned to Helsinki.
reviews.title: Unique

reviews.text: I was not sure whether to qualify this one as Excellent but decided against it - not because there is something I don;t like, but I simply think that excellence is extremely rare.
reviews.title: A great little pied de terre for a weekend in Helsinki.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for 2 nights as part of our tour around scandinavia on 12th and 13th April (so not in high season). Staff were very good. The views from the cocktail bar upstairs were a real bonus as we didn't know about that!
reviews.title: Highly Recommended!

reviews.text: We were offered a choice of rooms - romantic or modern. We went with modern. Lovely and clean and good size.
reviews.title: Good location, helpful staff and good restaurant

reviews.text: Would go back again.
reviews.title: Very Comfortable, nice interior, very quiet

reviews.text: We also liked it as it's set back from the main areas but close enough to everywhere.
reviews.title: spoil yourself in the 20s of helsinki

reviews.text: This was my second visit to this hotel and this time I got one of the "design" rooms on the upper floors. Very modern, light and airy but the glass partitions between room, bathroom and WC need some getting used to! OK if you're alone, less so if you are accompanied!
reviews.title: great place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We got a great deal at the Sokos Hotel Torni and booked a Standard Double online. We're aware that hotels in Helsinki are quite expensive so were really happy with our room given the rate we actually paid.
reviews.title: Really happy with this hotel for leisure stay

reviews.text: It had a great central location and was an easy walk from the train station where the airport bus dropped us off. There were some roadworks occurring directly in front of the hotel so a small walk through the gravel was required, but taxis were still accessible from the nearby streets. The location was on the doorstep of the central shopping district and a short stroll to the waterfront.
reviews.title: Comfortable with Good Location

reviews.text: Staff were friendly and informative, and our room was very large and comfortable. The bed was huge, there was plenty of space to place our luggage, and the compact ensuite was clean and modern. We were really happy with the standard of the rooms which were refurbished, modern and immaculate. The bed was extremely comfortable and light blocking curtains made for a good night's sleep.
reviews.title: Good hotel for business trip

reviews.text: The hotel overall was very quiet and we couldn't hear noise from neighbouring rooms. We were surrounded by plenty of eating establishments and nightlife so didn't get a chance to check out the hotel's own bars and restaurants.
reviews.title: Beware the elevator!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We'd definitely stay here again if given the opportunity - it had lots of character with all the mod cons.
reviews.title: Great Hotel!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just spent 2 nights at Sokos Torni in Helsinki. The hotel is a beautiful art deco hotel. Since both me and my boyfriend are big art deco fans this was perfect for us. The original part was build in 1936, and a bit later it was added a new part in art nouveau. Torni, off course meaning tower, is located in the city center and was until sometime in the 80s the tallest building in Helsinki. We stayed on second floor, and the room was allright. I wish I had spent a little bit more money on the room though, as I have heard they get nicer a bit more up.
reviews.title: Beautiful art deco hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff is very friendly and everything is very clean. They also have a restaurant, an american bar, an irish pub, an outside grill bar and my favorite: Atelje, the roof top bar.
reviews.title: A Great Choice

reviews.text: From the roof you could enjoy a nice, cold, dry cider while watching the beautiful view.
reviews.title: Love the art deco but please get a porter

reviews.text: My wife & I spent 3 nights at the Hotel Sokos Torni and couldn't have wished for more. The hotel was well located only a short 10 min or less walk to the City Centre, Central Station and bus interchange.
reviews.title: Why can't all hotels be like this

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room we stayed in (room 305) was clean and well decorated, and included a mini bar as well as TV and free WIFI with excellent reception and speed. The beds were soft compared to some of the others we have slept in in Europe but very comfortable all the same.
reviews.title: Herbert Hoover Once Stayed Here

description: Sokos Hotel Torni is one of the most important landmarks in Helsinki, a classic with staying power in the heart of the city. Quiet location in Helsinki Design District, right next to the shopping and the entertainment area of Helsinki. We welcome you to experience the unique Torni spirit.
